entry.title: Horne Book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the crucifix on the cover of the Horne Book (pictured) is made of walrus ivory?

entry.title: spirit liverwort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the spirit liverwort is called such because of its proximity to the Māori afterlife?

entry.title: Angelle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Angelle's debut single was promoted with an entire television channel – and still only reached number 43 on the UK Singles Chart?

entry.title: Fursan al-Aqsa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the video game Fursan al-Aqsa received an update that allows players to reenact the October 7 attacks on Israel?

entry.title: Lentinus brumalis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that cultures of the fungus Lentinus brumalis have been flown on three different satellites?

entry.title: alkanet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the English herbalist Nicholas Culpeper claimed that eating alkanet leaves would make a person's spit deadly to serpents?

entry.title: an artificial island composed of waste thrown overboard from ships (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Native Americans in Seattle sought refuge on an artificial island composed of waste thrown overboard from ships?

entry.title: Shelton Tappes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the UAW's 1941 union contract with the Ford Motor Company included a then-unique antidiscrimination clause negotiated by Black foundryman Shelton Tappes?

entry.title: Herobrine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the urban legend Herobrine was ranked on a Guinness World Records poll of the best video game villains, despite never existing?
